<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 209]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 356, 233]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3 (P3)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 259, 455, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 322, 390, 339]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 352, 828, 368]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 368, 722, 384]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 327, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 447, 284, 463]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 590, 510]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 606, 526]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 540, 606, 556]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 556, 756, 572]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 572, 440, 588]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 588, 907, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 384, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(|x - 2| = \left|\frac{1}{3} x\right|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 117, 92, 136]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 117, 547, 137]]<|/det|>
The sequence of values given by the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[413, 144, 583, 181]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = \frac{x_{n}(x_{n}^{3} + 100)}{2(x_{n}^{3} + 25)},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 186, 455, 205]]<|/det|>
with initial value \(x_{1} = 3.5\), converges to \(\alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 217, 154, 234]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 216, 920, 250]]<|/det|>
Use this formula to calculate \(\alpha\) correct to 4 decimal places, showing the result of each iteration to 6 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 234, 920, 252]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 262, 154, 280]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 262, 695, 280]]<|/det|>
State an equation satisfied by \(\alpha\) and hence find the exact value of \(\alpha\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 262, 920, 280]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 303, 94, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[339, 316, 695, 448]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 465, 920, 516]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the equation \(y = A\mathrm{e}^{- k x^{2}}\), where \(A\) and \(k\) are constants. The graph of \(\ln y\) against \(x^{2}\) is a straight line passing through the points (0.64, 0.76) and (1.69, 0.32), as shown in the diagram. Find the values of \(A\) and \(k\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 500, 920, 517]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 542, 92, 561]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 541, 920, 577]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(a x^{3} - 20 x^{2} + x + 3\), where \(a\) is a constant, is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). It is given that \((3x + 1)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 588, 156, 606]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 588, 316, 606]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 588, 920, 606]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 617, 153, 635]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 617, 551, 636]]<|/det|>
When \(a\) has this value, factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) completely.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 617, 920, 635]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 660, 96, 679]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[369, 667, 665, 823]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 842, 470, 861]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 866, 603, 887]]<|/det|>
\[x^{3} + x y^{2} + a y^{2} - 3 a x^{2} = 0,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 893, 920, 927]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) is a positive constant. The maximum point on the curve is \(M\). Find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(M\) in terms of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 911, 920, 928]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 78, 94, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 923, 102]]<|/det|>
By differentiating \(\frac{1}{\cos x}\), show that the derivative of \(\sec x\) is \(\sec x \tan x\). Hence show that if

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 448, 129]]<|/det|>
\(y = \ln (\sec x + \tan x)\) then \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \sec x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 142, 156, 161]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 141, 636, 161]]<|/det|>
Using the substitution \(x = (\sqrt{3}) \tan \theta\), find the exact value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 168, 571, 214]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{1}^{3}\frac{1}{\sqrt{(3 + x^{2})}}\mathrm{d}x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 220, 524, 240]]<|/det|>
expressing your answer as a single logarithm.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 221, 920, 240]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 267, 96, 286]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 267, 151, 286]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 266, 920, 317]]<|/det|>
By first expanding \(\cos (x + 45^{\circ})\), express \(\cos (x + 45^{\circ}) - (\sqrt{2}) \sin x\) in the form \(R \cos (x + \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0^{\circ} < \alpha < 90^{\circ}\). Give the value of \(R\) correct to 4 significant figures and the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 299, 920, 317]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 329, 151, 348]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 329, 364, 348]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[381, 355, 615, 375]]<|/det|>
\[\cos (x + 45^{\circ}) - (\sqrt{2}) \sin x = 2,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 381, 304, 400]]<|/det|>
for \(0^{\circ} < x < 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 382, 920, 400]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 433, 94, 453]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 428, 151, 448]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 428, 551, 460]]<|/det|>
Express \(\frac{1}{x^{2}(2x + 1)}\) in the form \(\frac{A}{x^{2}} +\frac{B}{x} +\frac{C}{2x + 1}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 433, 920, 453]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 473, 153, 492]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 473, 584, 492]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 497, 574, 530]]<|/det|>
\[y = x^{2}(2x + 1)\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 535, 920, 571]]<|/det|>
and \(y = 1\) when \(x = 1\). Solve the differential equation and find the exact value of \(y\) when \(x = 2\). Give your value of \(y\) in a form not involving logarithms.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 552, 920, 571]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 599, 96, 618]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 599, 144, 618]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 599, 920, 634]]<|/det|>
The complex number \(w\) is such that \(\operatorname {Re}w > 0\) and \(w + 3w^{*} = \mathrm{i}w^{2}\), where \(w^{*}\) denotes the complex conjugate of \(w\). Find \(w\), giving your answer in the form \(x + \mathrm{i}y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 615, 920, 634]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 644, 148, 663]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 644, 920, 695]]<|/det|>
On a sketch of an Argand diagram, shade the region whose points represent complex numbers \(z\) which satisfy both the inequalities \(|z - 2\mathrm{i}|\leqslant 2\) and \(0\leqslant \arg (z + 2)\leqslant \frac{1}{4}\pi\). Calculate the greatest value of \(|z|\) for points in this region, giving your answer correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 682, 920, 700]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 725, 104, 744]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 725, 920, 759]]<|/det|>
The points \(A\) and \(B\) have position vectors \(2\mathbf{i} - 3\mathbf{j} + 2\mathbf{k}\) and \(5\mathbf{i} - 2\mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k}\) respectively. The plane \(p\) has equation \(x + y = 5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 772, 153, 790]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 772, 920, 807]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of the point of intersection of the line through \(A\) and \(B\) and the plane \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 789, 920, 808]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 819, 153, 838]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 819, 920, 870]]<|/det|>
A second plane \(q\) has an equation of the form \(x + by + cz = d\), where \(b\), \(c\) and \(d\) are constants. The plane \(q\) contains the line \(AB\), and the acute angle between the planes \(p\) and \(q\) is \(60^{\circ}\). Find the equation of \(q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 852, 920, 870]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 75, 564, 90]]<|/det|>
# BLANK PAGE  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 873, 920, 909]]<|/det|>
